Reviews.Title: “Best of both Worlds - Gail Green/Living Adventure Inc.”
Reviews.Author: GailGreen
Reviews.Content: Old time Playa Del Carmen and the New Playa come together at the sister hotels Posada Mariposa & Hacienda Mariposa. The warm, family feel of a true Mexican 'posada' is preserved with a lobby and rooms that wrap around open air gardens of lush palms and colorful bougainvillea. But just a step outside and you're instantly infused in the excitement and glitz of the renowned 'Quinta Avenida'. These hotels are owned and managed by professionals who care about your experience and have upgraded their rooms to meet the 'boutique' experience without 'boutique' prices and without compromising a true feel of 'old Mexico'. I stay at Posada Mariposa on my personal trips as well as booking rooms for our groups that are traveling in the area. The occasional noisy night (hey, it's Fifth Avenue) is well offset by the courteous, genuine service and great location of this top notch hotel. It's my first choice for a place to stay in Playa Del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “clean,quiet,great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Roxdelgado
Reviews.Content: Hello this review can help u if u are looking for a hotel on the 5av (the most famous av in Playa del Carmen)with good deals . this was my second stay at Posada Mariposa, My knew room was over the second floor with a worderful gardin view , the room was exactly what I need off: clean, quiet,confortable bed and great location. the staff at the front desk is very helpful and the know great places for everything. I went to the italian restaurant and fell in love of the raviolis. thank guys Im hopping to get back as soon as posible.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel @ Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Armando E
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights and at the very moment me and my girlfriend entered to the lobby we were amazed. We stayed at the villa, at the top of the hotel (4th floor) with and incredible privacy and view. The room perfectly clean and lots of space. It is far from the noise, but in the middle of everything. A great restaurant upfront (free breakfast coupons from the hotel) and a convenience store 15 feet away. Definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, couldn't sleep”
Reviews.Author: James_n_Company
Reviews.Content: If you're not planning on sleeping at your hotel this is the place for you. Located in the heart of Playa del Carmen, the hotel was very inexpensive, there's no real seal on the room. Our room was a papala style on the roof so the partying all night could have been really in our bedroom! Not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lock up your valuables”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelers5561
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in Posada Mariposa for one week, but would have gone somewhere else if we could have after one night's stay. It's noisy - thank goodness I brought ear plugs, no screens in bathroom windows so mosquitoes come in, no pool and the courtyard is not comfortable to hang out in because the few chairs there are so uncomfortable. But the worst was, my sister forgot to put her engagement ring on before leaving her room and when she got back, it was gone from the box she'd placed it in. My cell phone charger went missing from my room two days later. Management was no help in trying to recover these things. The desk staff was always friendly to us, but I wouldn't stay here again if you paid me.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for its location right on Playa del Carmen’s northern popular 5th Avenue and close to Playa’s best beach”
Reviews.Author: Wayne D
Reviews.Content: Posada Mariposa is a great value for its location right on Playa del Carmen’s northern popular 5th Avenue and close to Playa’s best beach. They offer free beach towels and a great deal on one of the best beach clubs - Mamita’s Beach Club (45 pesos). The lobby is cute and inviting and the staff is friendly. We stayed in room #10 on 3rd floor (no elevator). It is a really cool room with a vaulted palapa roof, very nice ensuite bathroom, refrig., cable TV, and A/C with a private balcony. Along mile-long 5th Avenue (Avenida Quinta), you can stroll a cobblestone-like pavement of shops, boutiques, intimate hotels, restaurants, and sidewalk cafes. Our days passed quickly enjoying the beach and people watching during the day and choosing among the scores of restaurants at night. From Playa you can take a ferry to the large island of Cozumel for its great beaches, diving, and Mexican cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in downtown Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Susan V
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful little hotel, the rooms are built around a central courtyard that is full of plants. The rooms have windows overlooking the courtyard so it feels like you are looking outside. The hotel is located on the pedestrian only part of 5th Avenue - and there are many restaurants and shops to browse through in the area. The rooms are comfortable and have air conditioning. Th

Reviews.Title: “good couple night stay”
Reviews.Author: angeluvs
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. I didnt expect much. Staffs were friendly. However, they advertised free wi...There is NEVER Wifi..so dont bother bringing your laptop, i wasted luggage space, thinking there is wifi there. Other than that, great place to just sleep for the night. We were out most of the day and slept at night.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, nothing worked and location away from beach”
Reviews.Author: nathanwaks
Reviews.Content: Not sure I can understand other reviews- we had 2 rooms, very average quality and needing update- with many things not working- air con, lost door keys, wifi not working anywhere, rooms not ready on time-and location seemingly close to beach but not really- quite a lot of street noise- otherwise good location on 5th Av (shops and restaurants all the way up and down- for the price many better options with better beach locations - see my other reviews (why come to a beach resort and not be close unless you have no choice?) Staff very nice and helpful and apologetic, unfortunately not enough

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay (Dec 2011)!”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the Posada Mariposa. Jorge, Alejandra, Gisel, and Liliana (the receptionists) are wonderful: friendly, helpful, and nice. The rooms are reasonably priced, clean, with all the necessary amenities. The location is great: 5 minutes to the beach (with beach towels provided by the hotel) and right on Avenida Quinta. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aconchegante”
Reviews.Author: andreia36
Reviews.Content: Me and 11 friends stayed six days in Playa del Carmen staying at Posada Mariposa. Our first printout was very good since the arrival ... we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist called Gisel ... we had no difficulty with the language infirm, because the hostel staff is multilingual. The decor is rustic, very cozy, and there are plants, many plants (very green) decorating all rooms and all floors .. There, too, on every floor, beautiful rustic chairs. Ah! the posada offers free water and wi fi. Another quality is a great location .... near the beach Mamitas in the heart of Playa del Carmen. Our breakfast was done in front of Posada, a wonderful restaurant called La Vagabunda . And excellent service ! Ask for special Orange juice ! Just wonderful ! During all the days we enjoy of peace (the posada is silent) and comfort. Daily our bedroons was cleaned by very friendly maids. Another observation is related to the manager of Posada, Erick who was very friendly giving us valuable information about tourist places to visit . Thanks Erick for your precious informations ! I could summarize my days at Posada Mariposa this way : unforgettable ... a wonderful place, cozy, with good prices and excellent service. I really want to go back and bring more friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and style of hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenjenniferwalker
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so nice. Great service. That was the best. Loved the location, close to everything and 10 min walk to beach. Our room wasn't on 5th avenue, so the noise level was lower. We were on the second floor over looking the lobby, which was beautiful. Loved the fact that you could sit and drink or play cards throughout their sitting areas spread out around. Loved the roof top terrace which I did yoga by myself every morning. Loved their cold/hot water dispenser. I brought tea bags from home. Their soaps were natural and nice smelling. The only thing was after a shower there was high humidity in the bathroom and only a small window to dispurse it. So we always kept the bathroom door shut. Never used our airconditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: BozSkroz
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this hotel. Location fantastic, close to everything yet in not so noisy part of main street. Clean room, very pleasant look of the hotel both outside and inside, free wi-fi, drinking chilled water, and above all very friendly staff that helped us with hints and directions to local restaurants and places of interest. Stayed 5 nights before going for luxury of Cancun which did not spoil our impressions of Playa del Carmen and this lovely hotel. Would be absolutely happy to stay in same hotel if I visit that part of Mexico again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very cute, I would definetely go back ....”
Reviews.Author: Sabine C
Reviews.Content: Although it was located on the main street of Playa del Carmen, this Hotel was very pleasant, quiet, and close to everything. All of the people who work there deserve a nod. I have not even had people as pleasant at a 5 star resort! We are already planning a trip back next year. If you are looking for a nice hotel than this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location for the money”
Reviews.Author: snorkel_houndz
Reviews.Content: Situated on the quieter part of 5th ave, Posada Mariposa is great for the budget minded. Mini fridge in the room was handy for water and beer, and a few snacks. Close to Mamitas beach club as well. The bathroom wasnt all that clean on checkin but we mentioned it on our way out, and it was cleaned by the time we got back! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action in Playa”
Reviews.Author: dfmedrano
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the north side of the 5th avenue. Away enought from the noisy part that is packed with clubs and restaurants but only a few minutes' walk to get there. Rooms are clean, beds comfortable and have a safe box.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning my next trip!”
Reviews.Author: Simpson_Stephanie
Reviews.Content: I have been to Playa Del Carmen 3 or 4 times before and this was BY FAR my best experience. Check-in was quick and easy and from the moment I arrived the hotel staff were incredible. David greeted us and knew my name right as I walked in the door (I had called ahead and told the hotel I would be checking-in late). He was polite and very helpful, explaining where I could find the beach club, and restaurants that offered the discount included with my reservation as well as had great recommendations on where to find inexpensive food/ drinks. The hotel was in a central location, clean and provided a beautiful atmosphere. Quiet at night and within walking distance to all the best parts of Playa. I enjoyed my self so much, I extended my stay and cannot wait to get back! I could not have asked for a better vacation, thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “great location in the middle om avenida 5”
Reviews.Author: miksun
Reviews.Content: great value in off-season, nice rooms and bathroom, including breakfast next door. Make sure you ask for vouchers to the beach-club to get the discount, we missed that.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pippo06
Reviews.Content: On our last vacation we visited playa del Carmen, and we stayed at this pretty hotel right on the 5th ave. posada mariposa, it was such a pleasant stay, they have some extra services that makes your vacations more comfortable, such as the beach towels service, they have small fridges with candys water and beer and coupons for one of the most popular beach clubs at mamitas beach were you get a great discount on beach beds and umbrellas (we paid 30 pesos for two the whole day, wich is around 3 usd). The room smelled great, hotel was always neat and relaxing, so full of plants, and front desk guys are just amazing, they call you by your name and they recommended what to do every day and the must-visit places. Other thing, there is a huge iguana living at the hotel, my kids were so curious about this funny animal, but we just got to see it once. I feel like I want to go back, maybe we’ll be there for new years eve

Reviews.Title: “A true gem of a Posada / Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AntWill
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is adequate for what it is. In essence there is not a huge amount of service options in terms of room service, restaurant, hotel facilities (gym, pool etc) HOWEVER what little is on offer in that context is very helpfully provided. In basic terms the reception staff (Pepe gets a special mention), concierge and Sales/Reservations (Luis Alberto was very helpful with booking) are very friendly helpful people who clearly care about guests. I was impressed in this regard. I received a good upgrade into a mini-suite - spacious and comfortable with functional bathroom, a/c, TV etc. It is not luxurious though in the way you would rightly expect from a Boutique or 4* + hotel. This place does not claim to be that however so it is sold for what it is. Location is fantastic for Playa del Carmen, at the nicer end of 5th Avenue (i.e not so noisy, brash or in your face in touristy sense). Breakfast in restaurant opposite (10 yards away) was decent and convenient. Most liked the simple quality of place, staff, location and good value. Also flexible attitude Re extending stay etc Least liked the lack of even a small bar / coffee area to hang out in, no room service etc but I knew about this in advance so am only commenting. These things would be beneficial. The MAIN complaint I would have is the quality of the internet / wireless connections, even in the lobby. This was very frustrating and if I had been on business I would have had to move hotels to work. I would have been sad to move as it is a cracking place but such poor internet is unacceptable. Business travellers please check with Hotel prior to booking. Otherwise this place is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good for three stars”
Reviews.Author: Caldegol
Reviews.Content: The location is the best!! on 5th Ave. Near to Mamitas Beach. It is clean, quite, maybe the beds no too good, but is nice. Three years I have been in this place and I am not dissapointed. Good option, good prices by expedia , not from the posada´s website.

Reviews.Title: “If I will back to Playa It will be to tis hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gkarabaki
Reviews.Content: If you have any cuestion or problem ask Pepe & Pablo in reciption and you will find way the rating that's high! Gal karabaki-Israel

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but pricey and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: zenveg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Posada for 7 nights and the rooms are ok, decent size, nothing fancy, so my main complaint is due to the room charge. When I booked the room, I was quoted in dollars ($80/night) and by the time I checked out and was charged on my CC, it was $90/night. They charge your credit card in pesos so quoting in dollars is irrelevant due to the exchange rates. They should have adjusted final bill in pesos to match the original quote. Also, the intermittent wifi only works in the lobby area, though there's free wifi at the cafe across 5th so you're usually bouncing back and forth between the two if you have to get any work done. My room was in the back and it tended to get the noise from the machine shop below and the occasional loud music/party scene. The front desk staff were nice and helpful, but there are probably better places to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and quaint...perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: cancunpaula
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Playa many times for many years, usually at Hotel Alhambra on the South end. This time I thought I'd try to find a new "favorite hotel" on the newly chic, north end of Playa del Carmen. Posada Mariposa was recommended by a nearby Argentinian restaurant and the hotel was very earthy, romantic and beautiful with little hidden seating area, perfect for some alone time or while waiting for travel mates to get ready. The staff was gracious and watched our luggage all day after we checked out. The room was a little more plain than the hotel itself, but that is pretty usual in Playa and they were clean and adaquate. Very quiet A/C and no street noise at all. The room price (which was discounted when we walked in off the street last minute) included continental breakfast at a lovely place across the street and also a 1/2 price discount on beach chairs and unbrellas (net price 450 pesos) at the Mamitas Beach Club, which even on a hot day was not a bad stroll away at all and had free showers and bathrooms and drinks/food available. I was in the least expensive standard room with a friend...the bathroom was a bit small but perfectly fine for a few nights. I might choose a different hotel for an important romantic vacation, but I have a feeling there were larger and nicer rooms there....we did get ours at a discount! The beds were a comfortable change from the usually hard beds in the smaller hotels. The location was nearly at the end of 5th Avenue, where is really where you want to be. I will go back to Posada Mariposa...it was a very sweet place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: houliganski
Reviews.Content: Make sure that you book Posada Mariposa through Orbitz or Expedia, and NOT the hotel website. If you book it through Orbitz or Expedia you will get a free breakfast. The front desk is not friendly at all. The girl that checked us in and out had a personality of a brick wall. The beds were horrible, my back was killing me for 2 days. Please watch your credit card, I was told that my credit card will be charged $71 in pesos, but they charged me $83. They claim that their exchange rate is better, but it is a straight up lie! We were planning to spend at lease 3 nights at Posada, but instead we moved to Illusion Boutique Hotel close by, and it was a smart decision. Illusion was exceptional for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Rich_Tex
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel right on La Quinta Avenida exceeded my expectations. I was aware that their star rate a three. I will certainly rate their guest services, front desk and house keeping as a five star. I stayed at their "Palapa Suite". This mini suite is certainly not a 3 star rate, in all fairness, I believe it certainly deserves a four star rating. The property is beautifully decorated in a fusion of tropical and Mexican Hacienda style, there are plenty of mini living/lounge areas around the property where you can splurge while reading, relaxing and having an ice cold margarita. I would suggest paying a little extra to get an american breakfast. Mine was served at "La Vagabunda" one of Playa's hype and a "must try" breakfast bistro right in front of Posada Mariposa. This hotel is a jewel on the middle of the action of 5th Ave in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: perridon
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice quaint hotel on 5th ave. Great atmosphere and service. It was great to be on 5th ave. which is a pedestrian only street with tons of shopping and restaurants. The hotel is really close to the beach and offers 50% off at the beach club. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Solid 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Denver94
Reviews.Content: As my title suggested this is a solid 3 Star Hotel. Can you do better in Playa - yes. Can you do worse - absolutely. The rooms are clean, the staff is relatively helpful. The location is ideal (at least for us). The common areas of the hotel are what you would expect in Mexico. The beds offer decent comfort (the beds in Mexico are hard people!). We were told by guests that the rooms at the front of the hotel (on 5th) were a bit noisy but after 11 we heard nothing. All said and done this hotel wouldn't be my first choice to at again in Playa but I wouldn't avoid it either. Since you have to recommend yes or no with TripAdvisor I'm going to recommend but advise that you look around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and relaxing spot, thank you!!!!.”
Reviews.Author: CarlosMares
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Posada Mariposa last week, the hotel is really nice and the service was incredible, we were surprised when we heard the guys at the reception calling us by our names when we walked in the hotel for the first time, we didn’t expect that, the cleaning ladies were very polite and helpful, some of them does not speak English but that is not a problem at all, the rooms where very clean as they changed our blankets every day, always smelling great, we have been in many hotels and this is the first time we felt people really care about us, at the end of our stay, we didn’t think twice in leaving a very GOOD tip for them, they did an amazing job, we have nothing to say but thank you to all the staff that make us felt like royalty. Nice, clean and with good location, this is a place we strongly recommend, hope to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: FaGarzon
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spend Christmas and new year’s eve at this hotel, when we first saw the entrance we had our doubts about it , but we were totally wrong about our feelings, the hotel is really charming, quiet and calm, the staff is amazing, the guy in the reception was very friendly and courteous, he guide us on what to do every day, they have a great tours menu which i strongly recommend to look at. We also had our Christmas dinner at the hotel restaurant, just a few steps from the hotel, we are not an Italian food lovers but this time we did, the service was incredible and the food was exquisite, very good prices compared to other restaurants in the area. this is the third time we visit playa and has been the best of all, we usually stay in big all inclusive hotel but this time we wanted something different and not too expensive, we must say this hotel was the best decision we made for our vacations, the 5th ave was really crowded during the day as you can expect for the new year’s holidays but we loved it. We are definitely staying there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely HORRIBLE- DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: KA1213
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is good and it's CHEAP, but you get what you pay for big time!!! A rock hard bed, gloomy room with a strong odor of mildew & mold and a DISGUSTING bathroom to top it all off. We relied heavily on the other TA reviews and they were all good... they must be fake. It's impossible that anyone felt clean or comfortable in this place. We told the hotel right away that we didn't want to stay and we didn't feel comfortable and they basically said too bad. We had already paid and they weren't going to refund us- not even a percentage! They were very rude and unprofessional which i have never before experienced on my many trips to Mexico. Unfortunately we got stuck paying, but there was no way we were going to stay here. We went down the road a bit to the Blue Bay Grand Esmerelda, which we got a great deal on since it was last minute. THAT is what you call a vacation. All we were hoping for was a clean room and a decent bed. We knew going in that it wasn't going to be luxury. But is cleanliness to much to ask for? I don't think so. And to top it all off the free breakfast is toast and orange juice. That's it. Do yourself a favor and DONT stay here! Please it's HORRIBLE! Spend a little extra and stay at a better place on the strip like the Aventura Mexicana which we considered switching to and looked at the CLEAN rooms. Or, if you don't mind being off the strip stay at blue bay grand esmerelda. I'm so upset about the other misleading reviews that i read here. Feel free to email me if you need guidance. I am VERY serious about making sure this doesn't happen to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “More than the expected !”
Reviews.Author: jclp
Reviews.Content: We did for first time we move from italy to the caribean(my wife and me) and escape from the cold winter in the adriatic riviera... playa del carmen it's in somehow familiar, I 'm mexican ! but with many years out the country.... we choose an small hotel(Posada Mariposa),rustic style in the new 5a,very affrodable prices plus an rustic style but very comfortable... the advantage to be in the 5a it's real good, beach real life it's in every corner,people from all over places are walking and chilling out in the evenings hours... thursdays are a paint and art open exposicion called CAMINARTE(camina=walk,arte=art) I get in love with the place... the I wanted to take a vision to the around and we take an expedition to coba and tulum. Awesome more than expected! the tour haved a good reason: the mayan culture its fascinating!, coba its an a big mayan city,we took it a bicicle (they rent it inside the mayan city)cause it's big and extense to see in just 1 1/2 hour!!! we could take a deep vision of the ancient and actual culture plus for fortune we didn't take a big company tour,we was just a group of 8 people on the location(very pumpy road! to get there !) the cenote(sink hole was real impactant!)we made an easy rappel and swiming... then we eat and we went to tulum,WE recommend to bring some snacks and extra cool aid drinks in any roll out on the riviera,it's hot !!! we visited tulum too that day we recommend : Hotel Flamingo cozumel island(excellent service and prices!) Posada Mariposa Playa del Carmen Xibalba Expeditions Playa del Carmen and the tacos al pastor in any taqueria !!!

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further!”
Reviews.Author: NorCalErin
Reviews.Content: After a bad hotel experience (Hora Feliz 'condo' rental), we fled at the last minute to this gem. Staff is very accommodating, hotel is comfortable and in excellent location - quieter area of 5th avenue. Very family friendly. This place saved our vacation and is a safe home base from which to conduct your adventures. Filtered water on site (very convenient!), complimentary beach towel service, discount at beach club, close to everything. Hotel is well maintained and has great balcony for people watching on 5th. Lots of live plants and good energy. Many people walking on 5th avenue commented they wished they had stayed there instead of the places they wound up. Bring pesos to pay upon check in (or pre-pay through reputable travel site) - as there is an additional charge if you pay with credit card and/or us dollars at hotel location.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: wonderwoman
Reviews.Content: There are no amenities at Posada Mariposa, but its location on 5th Avenue within walking distance to the beach and restaurants makes this a perfect choice for those seeking a simple, clean hotel with character. My friend and I stayed there for 7 nights and we loved it! The front desk was always pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at Posada Mariposa! awesome rates too!”
Reviews.Author: Arracadas
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying...I had the best stay at this small hotel, clean, well priced and the best part..LOCATION!! I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I HIGHLY recommend it to anyone going to Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: flyinprincess
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel in 2005 based on a friends recommendation. We stayed in the little apartments and walked to the nearby grocery stores and cooked a lot for ourselves. Having a fridge for water/beer and snacks was great too. The place is always clean. Our latest trip was in 2009 and the town has grown a lot in the last few years. While our first trip was very peaceful and quiet, this last trip we were kept away by the thumping euro music blared by people in the next building over. Bring ear plugs in case. The building also has a beautiful roof top that you can sit at and watch the people stroll 5th ave below.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected”
Reviews.Author: CTDesign
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews before I selected this hotel and it met every expectation. I even treasured the hard beds! At the north end of the tourist district, it is away from the clubs but easy walking distance to everything you need. Many restaurants are within a block or two. The beach is only a few blocks away as well. The staff was as helpful as they could be. I've stayed in many small hotels before and realize that family run businesses are "what you see is what you get", but reasonable expectations are always met. The rooms were very clean and well kept while I stayed there. I was in PDC for a weekend wedding and was glad I chose Posada Mariposa instead of the all inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: voyageuseterre
Reviews.Content: With three of my friends I went to Posada Mariposa in PDC. We loved the place. We had two rooms; one standard plus and one junior suite both on the third floor. The one overlooking the 5th avenue was a bit noisy but since there is a separate door between the kitchenette and the bedroom, it stopped most of the noise. Our room (standard) was large enough with a big closet (all clothes, shoes and luggages for two girls fitted in the closet). The beds are hard but I prefer it to too soft. We had a little balcony, a mini-fridge and a large shower with enough water pressure. It is well situated in the old italian area where you have access to bars, restaurants, internat cafes, shops but without the crowd. the beach is less than five minute walk and with the hotel discount it costs you 15 pesos for a chair and an extra 15 pesos if you want a palapas. You will find restaurants on the beach and sometimes you will see locals selling fruits on the beach too. All in all, I loved my stay at Mariposa and would recommend to all my friends to at least once, experience the carribean not in an all inclusive resort. And I think Playa del Carmen is just the place for that.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME, Awesome... but until there are new beds- I wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: beachTraveler4Life
Reviews.Content: This place is just as it appears in the pictures- it's so eclectic and sweet- but good Lord- I woke up every hour- the beds are SOOO Hard! It's such a shame too... it's a great location, the guys at the front desk were wonderful, and it's beautiful- I hate to even say it- but my fiance and I said the exact same thing. The mattresses have got to go!!!!!! Hopefully our room is just an isolated bed? We've both stayed in other hotels in Mexico- and we know that the beds tend to be stiff- but this is rediculous! On the plus side, it's less than five minute walk to the beach, you're right in the middle of all the action- but with that said- it was never loud! Hotel Posada Mariposa... if you are reading this- email me when you get a new mattress and we'll stay again every year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel, but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: georden
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights. We had a ground floor standard room. We selected this hotel because of the majority of positive reviews on this web site of this hotel. We were surprised on how noisy it was 24 hours a day. We normally do not sleep with the air conditioner on, but we had to turn it on to cover up the noise. Even with the windows closed we heard conversations at the front desk and other guest walking up and down and stairs and doors opening and closing all night long. We liked the location and the service staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “No place else”
Reviews.Author: patyhart
Reviews.Content: I travel to Playa all the time, and have stayed in multiple hotels, but I really like the Posada Mariposa. It is on la Quinta Avenida (5th Ave) on the north side, but has consistently been one of the best values. This last trip was positively excellent. We arrived early and they kept our bags till our room was ready. The ground floor room (#15) was excellent! The staff has always been wonderful and the hotel spotless. The TV had an enormous number of English channels (for my husband) and great reception. One of our favorite restaurants (La vagabunda) is right accross the street so very convenient. One of the quietest hotels in Playa. A/C worked almost toooo well. Maid service perfect and her towel oragamis were positively gorgeous, including a lady sitting reading a book. Had never seen that one. Amazing. Lots of vegetation in the open common areas. I would recommend this hotel over most all others for value and comfort. Even the beds were not hard as a rock!

Reviews.Title: “OK If You're on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: dragonia64
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a charming courtyard area and the staff is pleasant. The place is very clean and AC worked well. Room was on the small side (I had a standard ground floor unit). The location right on 5th Avenue was terrific. My biggest complaints were: There is no parking at the hotel itself. So, beware if you have a rental car, you will have to park on one of the side streets near the hotel. The bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable. I heard this is typical of Mexican beds, but the hotel where I stayed in Cozumel was much more comfortable and it also was a budget place. The noise from people opening and closing their doors was horrible. Due to the courtyard setting, everything echoes and the doors just slam. Luckily, it was quiet at night and not a party type place so I was able to still get a good night's sleep - but forget about the ability to take an afternoon siesta. All in all, if you are on a tight budget and want to be in a good location and safe, this is a good choice. If you are expecting anything more than very average accomodations, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay, Would Go Back Again.....”
Reviews.Author: Didem76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Posada Mariposa at very beginning of October 2008 and spent 4 nights. It is not a luxury hotel but had everything I needed. I had a such a good time there, felt like home and very safe even I was travelling alone. Very warm, nice atmosphere, very helpful and nice people. They are always there to answer your questions. Hotel is right on 5th Avenue of Playa del Carmen and 2 minutes walk to the nicest beach Playa Mammitas. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to everybody. P.S. Have dinner at Babe's if you like Thai Food on 5th Avenue, Calle 10, very good.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: j11201
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here as part of a package we booked with Expedia, and paid around $60/night. For that price, I thought the hotel was great. It's similar to other budget hotels in the area, e.g. Luna Blue, but I prefered it because of the location and the cleanliness of the hotel. There was some construction noise, but I think that's just because all of Playa is under construction -- it's sort of unavoidable. The front desk staff was very nice, the beds were comfortable, the AC worked, and the room was clean. Overall I would definitely recommend it for travelers looking for a good deal who don't need a lot of frills.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect till checkout”
Reviews.Author: Looban
Reviews.Content: My family and I we booked the hotel through expedia.com, decided a few days before that my little sister is going to come too, we called expedia and they called the hotel, everything was fine we just had to pay an extra charge of 10 dollars per night. The hotels suites are too small for 4 people so we stayed at the around the corner at the condohotel el patio. We liked the location a lot, it was on the 5th AVE and also close to the beach. With a little ticket from the Front Desk we were able to get everything half price at the beach club which has a partnership with the hotel. The service was really nice and I never experienced such helpful people on the frontdesk. Employees on the frontdesk were speaking english 24 hours. We never had trouble because of the language. Sometimes the AC gave us a little hard time but it didnt bither us that much. The water pressure could have been better but we were able to shower and there was also enough hot water for 4 people showering at least twice a day. My dad left after 4 days and we booked for 5 days, after 4 days we went to the front desk and asked if we could stay 2 more days jsut 3 people and it wasn't a problem, we paid for the last days in cash all in advance. At our last night of the trip we went to the front desk and asked if I could check out after my parents because we had different flights and it wasnt a problem, my mom also made sure if all bills are paid that there wont be surprises when I check out as the last person. On the next morning my mom and sister left early in the morning to the airport and I went to eat breakfast and on a last little shopping trip. When I come back to the room to get my luggage I find a note on the table which said I would have to pay 101 USD for a missing difference because we changed the room, but it was billed from our credit card through expedia.com. I didn't want to miss my bus to the airport so I just gave them my credit card and they charged me 101 dollars. If I would have had more time I would have argued but it just didn't work out. After I paid the "difference" they handed an envelope to me with 50 dollar for the safe key deposit. I didn't even know about that cause my dad didn't tell me about it. The whole check-out was really strange... When I got home i talked to my mom about it and she wanted a statement from the hotel about it, but suddenly nobody spoke english. We also contacted expedia.com if they might be able to help us but they were not able to contact them. Now we went through mastercard and they took the amount of after i wrote a statement. We loved the stay there till the checkout, we would have came back but now it ruined our nice memories, because it was just not necessary.

Reviews.Title: “highly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: betadin
Reviews.Content: We have been disappointed from the firt contact: they were doing restyling work., and the workers woke us up at 8 AM every morning (even on Saturday). It was like to live in an erecting yard: painting, smashing a hammer into a wall and other noises all day. Furthermore we discovered that we had to pay an extra of 12% if paying with credit card (it wasn't clearly written in the reservation). In the reservation there were 3 option for breakfast, and we discovered that the hotel doesn't have a restaurant and it's not possible to have breakfast there or everywhere else. The receptionists even after 5 days didn't know our faces: I suppose they could have given the room key at whomever... The air conditioned didn't work properly: you could choose between sweat or freeze.. no half way! The only thing that makes me write that it's not terrible is that the bed wasn't bad and the room was clean and tidy. Thanks to roomkeepers! Before we left we ask for a reduction of the price, as a compensation for the unconfortable staying.. but all the receptionists are young boys and even asking the day before it wasn't possible to speek with the manager or someone else "in charge" of the place. With our great regret we knew that the owners are italians, as we are. We can firmly assure that this isn't the italian style!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbooger
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Posada Mariposa. We both enjoyed our time very much at this quaint little hotel. I've traveled for work and pleasure quite a bit and stayed in all kinds of accomodations( from hostels and Motel 6's, mainstream Hyatts, Marriots, to luxury and boutique hotels such as those of the Kor group). My mother is slightly obsessive about cleanliness, and I am about service. We chose this hotel as opposed to an all-inclusive resort because we knew we were going to be gone site-seeing the majority of the time and just needed a safe, and clean place to lay our head at night and help point us in the right direction when needed. So we weren't looking for a lot of bells and whistles, just clean and safe. I was a little apprehensive getting there because it seemed to good to be true ( especially since we booked last minute). I emailed and spoke with Nadyelli quite a few times even before arriving and always got a prompt and courteous response. She was so patient, helpful , informative, and happy to be of service. My only dissapointment was that I never got to meet her personally to thank her for all her help. Alfonso and Axel at the reception desk wear many hats ( concierge, bell hop,etc). They also were very helpful, informative, nice, and always delivered service with a smile! They are the kind of guys you could easily just hang out and chat all day with. On our last day, our airport shuttle came 45minutes early. Axel sent someone to the restaurant we were having brunch at so we would not miss our shuttle. They always went above and beyond the call of duty and did so happily. You can't get this kind of service at a large chain hotel anymore. Surprisingly, the maids cleaned our rooms to my mothers satisfaction. So overall I would have to say that the service was one of the best things about this hotel. Hotel itself: FREE internet connection if you bring your laptop, SANS phone( but someone at reception will be happy to make a local call for you for free, and there is a calling booth right across the way) simple, clean, natural al-fresco garden setting, 23 total rooms, staircases only, firm mattresses, TV ,mini fridge, A/C, ceiling fan,outdoor seating, fun towel sculptures. Just the bare necessities. Think a budget version of the TIDES hotel without any bells or whistles. Location: If you are familiar with Santa Monica, California think "3rd St. Promenade" WITHOUT all the loud crazy people, smelly homeless, weird street performers. Quinta Avenida is full of great and unique bars & restaurants, shopping, gelato/ice cream, spas, internet and calling booths, siteseeing information stands, and other boutique/budget/ and mid-range hotels. It's safe, clean, eco-friendly (trash bins have biodegradable and recycling) and not over populated-yet. For those of you that are lame and boring there is a Subway, Starbucks, Burger King, Mc Donalds and even a freakin Wal-Mart(ugh!). If you don't mind not being directly on the beach this location can't get any better! The guests at the hotel ranged from college spring-breakers, backpackers, young couples , old couples, gay couples and group travelers. Americans, Europeans, and pretty much everywhere else. Mamitas beach is two small blocks away, bus station is walking distance, as is the ferry to Cozumel, you can grab a cab on every corner. This is the heart of Playa del Carmen. Cancun airport is about 30-40 minutes away, Xel-Ha, Tulum ,Xcaret, are all about 15-30 minutes away. PlayaCar (the residential/resort neighborhood is walking distance 15-20 min or a 30-60 peso ($3-6 USD). There is quite a bit of construction going on right now all over PDC. It didn't bother us too much because we got up fairly early anyhow. But you may want to take some earplugs just in case. Right now virtually everyone takes $USD, but make sure to carry smaller bills as they often cannot make change. My mother got a 2 hour massage and facial for $75 USD!!! These spa stands are all over Quinta Avenida. Favorite places: Quinta Passion restaurant is an authentic Mayan casual reasonably priced restaurant located right under El Condo Patio Hotel on Quinta Avenida (26th). Service was great everytime except once when they gave us the incorrect change back, but they happily corrected the problem. Try the lava bowl if you like seafood and the "sopa de lima" if you like tangy and tasty. 100% Natural restaurant also on Quinta Avenida (22nd?) was a huge hit for us. There are a few locations, the one closer to PlayaCar looks like the Rainforest Cafe, its pretty neat. You will esp like it if you are into fresh, healthy, vegetarian or macrobiotic eating. It is like Jamba Juice meets Whole Foods. Again, reasonably priced and the menu is pretty extensive. The Argentine guy that runs the one closest to the Mariposa is super cool too. Try the whole wheat pecan pancakes or their fresh juices. If you want something a little more of a high-end ambience on Quinta Avenida, there are plenty of those too. SUR was nice and the food was good too. Try the caviar or shrimp appetizer. Site-seiing wise I would recommend the Tulum/ Xel-Ha eco-park package( not as big as Xcaret but it still takes all day to experience the entire park). Tulum is great for those into Mayan history and is a gorgeous site to see. Xel-ha is an eco park with dolphins, fish, stingray, wild birds, mangroves, "cenotes". You can bike, snorkel, swim w/dolphins, kayak, sunbathe on the beach, lay in a hammock, float down the river on an inner tube, jump off a cliff into the water "Tarzan" style, amoungst many other activities most of which are included in the entrance fee. Best part is unlimited food and bev ( and that means alcohol too!) all day long! Loved this tour package! Chinchi Nitza ( sp?) is great for history buffs, but it is a 3 hour trip just to get there. MUST SEE- the cenotes. These underground waterways are a marvel! They are found all around PDC. If you are into snorkeling Alfonso at the Posada Mariposa has a personal favorite( about 2.5 hours south) that sounded great, but we ran out of time. I also wish we'd taken the ferry to Cozumel. So much to see and do and so little time. Be sure to take the time to talk with Axel and Alfonso, they are very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “posada mariposa is awesome”
Reviews.Author: BigBossToronto
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Mariposa with my sweetheart for a duration of four nights and absolutely loved my stay. Like most of you, i checked out the reviews before hand but I was more than impressed when I actually got there. My man Axel and the rest of the front desk crew couldn't possibly be any nicer or any more accomodating than they were. We arrived early, and although check in time is 2pm, Axel went out of his way to make sure we could get our room immediatley and that was greatly appreciated. The hotel has such an awesome rustic, natural feel, that it truly is beautiful, small and quaint. The rooms were wicked too. Super clean, lots of hotwater, absolutely no bugs, and a fully functioning t.v. with lots of channels and a small fridge. The hotel made our stay that much more enjoyable and I will definitely been staying at the Mariposa on future visits and I will certainly be recommending it to anyone that is going to playa. The location is so close to mamita's beach that you can feel it and at the risk of being redundent, the mariposa is awesome. Thanks Axel!!! p.s. this is a 4:20 friendly hotel to those of you that know whaddup.....

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, but overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: OregonBeer
Reviews.Content: We had a little difficulty finding the Posada Mariposa, as it's on a pedestrian-only street. We arrived an hour earlier than the stated check-in time, and were told that our room wasn't ready yet. Not a big deal, we just wanted to park our bags and go to the beach anyway, but then we were told that our room would not be ready until 3:00, an hour AFTER check-in time. When we asked why, the guy at the front desk said that only 2 out of 4 housekeepers showed up, and that they were behind, but working as fast as they could. Of course, it was kind of annoying looking across the lobby and seeing THREE housekeepers sitting down at break/lunch, but it wasn't a big deal in the scheme of things. The front desk clerk was very friendly, and put our bags behind his desk. We asked where the hotel parking was, and he said the hotel had no parking, and we had to park on the street. We managed to get a spot within a couple hundred yards of the hotel. The room was clean, moderately sized, standard furnishings, but no view. It was on the 3rd floor (out of four); elderly/disabled folks beware, there is no elevator. The hotel is well-located on the north (and somewhat quieter) part of Quinta Avenida, but is not on the beach, if that's important to you. We only stayed one night, and both my wife and I weren't thrilled with the hotel. We couldn't figure out why, because really, the hotel was decent and met all of our needs. What it came down to was value, and we felt that we overpaid a good $20-30 per night for what we got, given the lack of amenities (view, elevator, pool, secure parking, etc.). I'm not sure if this was a Playa del Carmen thing, or it was specific to the Posada Mariposa, or a combination of both, but in the end, if we were to stay in Playa del Carmen again, we would try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Perfect”
Reviews.Author: vialux
Reviews.Content: On outstanding surprise on all counts! I found this gem online and although prebooking Mexico hotels has been problematic in the past, my experience was flawless from booking through having to say goodbye. E-mails were answered quickly, check in was a breeze, the staff are spot on and the location at the more subdued north end of the avenue was refreshing. I was shown to my room without having to pay or check in as I arrived rather late. When's the last time that happened to you? My thanks to Nadyelli, Keila and the rest of the nice ladies at the desk and to Alex for going the extra mile to make sure I was comfortable (ask to see his artwork). A+ for the budget traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Simple & Charming”
Reviews.Author: coloradowanderer
Reviews.Content: As a budget traveler this hotel is great for the price. We found an online deal that was $20 a night less than the walk in rate. Feel free to email me to talk prices. In a quiet area, all the rooms face towards the interior courtyard of plants, trees and vines. A wooden table and two chairs were outside each room. We always used the spiral staircase up to our simple room on the 2nd floor. Fridge, A/C, cable, large closet, and tile bathroom were fine. Hot water in the shower took a minute to heat up and the beds were a bit firm, but I don't mind. We stayed 3 nights and our room was always clean and towels were made into swans and hearts each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fm11709
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it is near a condo I am buying. What a GREAT hotel! Friendly, helpful staff and beautiful tropical atrium lobby great you when you first arrive. I was led to my room on the third (top) floor - it wasnt huge, but it had a queen and full bed, and a very ample bathroom. The furnishings, floor and walls were perfectly clean, and very comfortable. The tv worked great, the shower had plenty of hot water and great water pressure. There was really no view from the two windows, but outside of each room is a wooden table and chairs, overlooking the lobby atrium. Its on the quiet end of 5th Avenue, so there was no noise from the street or from other guests. There is no phone in the room, which was no problem, and no shampoo was provided. But I would recommend this hotel to any budget traveler, or anyone who will be spending most of their time out enjoying all that Playa has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little, cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAddict
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and were very pleased with friendly service, location to the beach and 5th av. The entire place is very "non chain" and has a romantic rustic feel. Do LOCK all your valuables inside provided safe. On the last day, we went to the beach at 6am and left some cache in a beach bag which was gone when we returned at 9am. Nothing else was taken (everything important was in the safe) but it was still unpleasant though not big enough to make a huge complaint about at check-out time.

HotelInfo.Name: Posada Mariposa
HotelInfo.Address: 5 Ave. 24th & 26Th | street Col. Centro Solidaridad, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
